greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of the nonzero digital products of n for all the bases 1 to n (a 'total digital-product factorial').
formula: a(n)=product{1<=p<=n, dp_p(n)} where dp_p(n) = product of the nonzero digits of n in base p.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {p = 1; for (b=2, n, digs = digits(n, b); p *= prod(k=1, #digs, if (digs[k], digs[k], 1));); return (p);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 15 2013
results.author: _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jul 08 2007
